cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) subfield of Computer Science, which is covered by several arXiv CS sub-categories. The paper deals with reference resolution, which is a core problem in NLP. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to NLP, including syntax, semantics, discourse, and dialogue. 

The paper also proposes evaluation algorithms for reference resolution, which involves machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another likely sub-category. 

The paper uses formalism and algorithms to evaluate reference resolution, which involves mathematical and statistical methods. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are also possible sub-categories. 

Finally, the paper discusses the relative importance of recall vs. precision errors, which is a topic related to optimization and decision-making. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is another possible sub-category.
